questions.question: This movement started as a hashtag - #blacklivesmatter

imageMetadata.resources: #BlackLivesMatter was created as a call of action in response to the killing of Trayvon Martin by George Zimmerman.

questions.resources: #BlackLivesMatter was created as a call of action in response to the killing of Trayvon Martin by George Zimmerman.

questions.question: BLM is a leaderless movement.

imageMetadata.resources: The Black Lives Matter Movement is a leaderfull movement. BLM challenges members of the Black community to do their part in addressing the systematic racism in society. Each person is a leader to help create change.

questions.resources: The Black Lives Matter Movement is a leaderfull movement. BLM challenges members of the Black community to do their part in addressing the systematic racism in society. Each person is a leader to help create change.

questions.question: To say,  "Black Lives Matter" is to insinuate that only "Black Lives Matter".

imageMetadata.resources: BLM is a response to systematic oppression that consistently say the lives of Black people do not matter. To say that All Lives Matter in response to BLM is to neglect the Black experience of ongoing systematic oppression, incarceration and violence.

questions.resources: BLM is a response to systematic oppression that consistently say the lives of Black people do not matter. To say that All Lives Matter in response to BLM is to neglect the Black experience of ongoing systematic oppression, incarceration and violence.

questions.question: #blacklivesmatter is Unapologetically Black

imageMetadata.resources: BLM is unapologetically Black in their positioning. In affirming that Black Lives Matter, they feel no need to qualify their position. To love and desire freedom and justice for Black people is a necessary prerequisite for wanting the same for others.

questions.resources: BLM is unapologetically Black in their positioning. In affirming that Black Lives Matter, they feel no need to qualify their position. To love and desire freedom and justice for Black people is a necessary prerequisite for wanting the same for others.

questions.question: BLM protest are meant to provoke violence and looting

imageMetadata.resources: Demonstrations are intended to bring peaceful awareness to the cause, but are also meant to show the outrage for the injustices placed upon the Black community.

questions.resources: Demonstrations are intended to bring peaceful awareness to the cause, but are also meant to show the outrage for the injustices placed upon the Black community.

questions.question: Black Lives Matter divides it's own community

imageMetadata.resources: While there are differing opinions regarding the strategies to combat injustice within the community, BLM believes in the intersectionality of the modern day Black person. They believe all Black lives matter, regardless of actual or perceived sexual identity, gender identity, gender expression, economic status, ability, disability, religious beliefs or disbeliefs, immigration status or location.

questions.resources: While there are differing opinions regarding the strategies to combat injustice within the community, BLM believes in the intersectionality of the modern day Black person. They believe all Black lives matter, regardless of actual or perceived sexual identity, gender identity, gender expression, economic status, ability, disability, religious beliefs or disbeliefs, immigration status or location.

questions.question: Black Lives Matter is unorganized.

imageMetadata.resources: Black Lives Matter is an organization comprised of 38 chapters across the country and Canada. It is also collaborates with many local leaders and local organization including Black Youth Project 100, the Dream Defenders, The Organization of Black Struggle, Hands Up United, and Millennial Activists United.

questions.resources: Black Lives Matter is an organization comprised of 38 chapters across the country and Canada. It is also collaborates with many local leaders and local organization including Black Youth Project 100, the Dream Defenders, The Organization of Black Struggle, Hands Up United, and Millennial Activists United.

questions.question: #blacklivesmatter is anti-police

imageMetadata.resources: The Black Lives Matter movement is not trying to make the world more unsafe for police officers; it hopes to make police officers less of a threat to communities of color. Thus, they reject the idea that asking officers questions about why one is being stopped or arrested, about what one is being charged with, constitutes either disrespect or resistance. They reject the use of military-grade weapons as appropriate policing mechanisms for any American community.

questions.resources: The Black Lives Matter movement is not trying to make the world more unsafe for police officers; it hopes to make police officers less of a threat to communities of color. Thus, they reject the idea that asking officers questions about why one is being stopped or arrested, about what one is being charged with, constitutes either disrespect or resistance. They reject the use of military-grade weapons as appropriate policing mechanisms for any American community.

questions.question: The movement hates white people.

imageMetadata.resources: The statement “black lives matter” is not an anti-white proposition. Contained within the statement is an unspoken but implied “too,” as in “black lives matter, too,” which suggests that the statement is one of inclusion rather than exclusion. However, those white people who continue to mischaracterize the affirmation of the value of black life as being anti-white are suggesting that in order for white lives to matter, black lives cannot.
